s0564.literal: Appraisal says: Han inherited the decline of a hundred kings; Gaozu eliminated chaos and returned to correctness; Wen and Jing devoted themselves to nourishing the people, but as for matters of investigating ancient rites and culture, there were still many deficiencies.
s0564.idiomatic: Appraisal: The Han dynasty inherited the decline of a hundred kings. Gaozu eliminated chaos and restored proper order; Emperors Wen and Jing devoted themselves to nourishing the people, but in matters of investigating ancient rites and culture, there were still many deficiencies.

s0565.literal: Emperor Wu initially established himself, outstandingly dismissed and rejected the hundred schools, honored and exalted the six classics.
s0565.idiomatic: When Emperor Wu first ascended the throne, he outstandingly dismissed and rejected the hundred schools of thought, honoring and exalting the six classics.

s0566.literal: He then surveyed the realm within the seas, raised their outstanding talents, and established merit with them.
s0566.idiomatic: He then surveyed the realm within the four seas, raised their outstanding talents, and established great achievements with them.
